quote_last: , we fall in again with a fine portion of the ancient road, which the modern track constantly follows, and descend by some steep windings, hewn in the side of a precipitous cliff, to the place where the Ouad-el-Haoud commences.
title: Narrative of a Journey round the Dead Sea and in the Bible lands in 1850 and 1851
